title: Microsoft Faces Fresh Antitrust Complaint in Europe
description: An industry group is alleging that company’s business practices give it an unfair advantage over cloud-services competitors.

title: Lucid To Raise Up To $1.5 Billion on Share Sales
description: The auto maker says third-quarter losses widened from the same period a year earlier, to $670.2 million

title: Meta's Mark Zuckerberg Says He Is Accountable as Company Preps for Mass Layoffs
description: Meta Platforms will begin laying off employees on Wednesday morning, CEO Mark Zuckerberg told hundreds of executives on Tuesday.

title: Netflix Explores Investing in Sports Leagues, Streaming-Rights Bidding
description: The streaming giant has looked at sports like tennis and surfing, but Co-CEO Reed Hastings has been wary of the rising costs for rights.

title: EU to Further Probe Microsoft's Deal for Activision
description: Watchdog group says it’s concerned the acquisition could reduce competition in the global videogaming industry

title: Crypto Exchange Binance to Acquire Rival FTX
description: The deal came on the heels of cryptocurrency companies and individual traders pulling money from FTX over concerns about the financial stability of the exchange and closely linked trading firm Alameda Research.

title: Tesla Releases Fix to Address Recall of 40,000 U.S. Vehicles
description: Electric car maker reports faulty power-steering on Model S, Model X

title: Nvidia Offers Alternative Chip for China to Clear U.S. Export Hurdles
description: The new graphics-processing chip, branded the A800, replaces the A100, a chip widely used in servers and AI applications by Alibaba, Tencent and Baidu.

title: Theranos Founder Holmes Is Denied a Bid for New Trial
description: A federal judge denied Elizabeth Holmes’s bid for a new trial, the latest setback for the Theranos founder who was convicted of fraud in January.
